metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17498 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: In libssh2 v1.9.0 and earlier versions, the SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT logic in packet.c has an integer overflow in a bounds check, enabling an attacker to specify an arbitrary (out-of-bounds) offset for a subsequent memory read. A crafted SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server. It was discovered that libssh2 incorrectly handled bound checks in SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or obtain sensitive information.

criterions.comment: libssh2 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.0-1').
